cs.IT, cs.CR, cs.DM, cs.CC, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with secret sharing schemes, which are commonly studied in the information theory (cs.IT) and cryptography (cs.CR) communities. The concept of access structures is related to combinatorial designs and matroids, which are topics in discrete mathematics (cs.DM). The paper also discusses the efficiency of secret sharing schemes, which can be analyzed using coding theory (cs.CC) techniques. Finally, the paper may be relevant to the field of secure multi-party computation (cs.SI), which involves multiple parties collaborating to perform a computation while keeping their inputs private.
